section.title: Introduction
section.para: The purpose of this documentation is to describe how to use the virtual appliance which embeds Ulteo Open Virtual Desktop components such as Session Manager, Web Portal, FileServer and Linux Application Server. Note that the Virtual Appliance delivers the Community Edition of Ulteo. To upgrade to the OVD Premium Edition, refer to the information here

section.title: Installation
section.para: OVD Virtual appliance works with both VMware or VirtualBox. For easy setup, use a DHCP network with a bridged interface on your host machine configuration.

section.title: VMWare Installation
section.para: You can use for demo VMWare Player.
Once launched, import your ova file into VMWare Player
The OVD Virtual appliance is now running !

section.title: VirtualBox Installation
section.para: The Virtual Appliance may also be installed using VirtualBox.
Start VirtualBox and import the Ulteo ova file
By default, VirtualBox fails to assign a network interface. You need to update it in the Virtual Machine settings
Open the settings box and confirm the information by clicking on OK
The OVD Virtual Appliance is now running !

section.title: Running the Virtual Appliance
section.para: The OVD Virtual appliance is easy to use and allows you to quickly get an idea of what OVD is and how this works. Check the shell console to get the IP addess.
Documentation on the Web Portal settings and how to use it is available here
Once running, you have access to an OVD farm for demo or testing purposes.
